senses.ex: His business turned out to be very profitable.

Tips.title: Business Context
Tips.description: Often used to describe businesses or investments that generate significant financial returns or income.
Tips.example: This year, the tech sector proved to be quite profitable.

Tips.title: Financial Success
Tips.description: Emphasizes the achievement of financial gain, suggesting that the endeavor was worth the effort or investment.
Tips.example: Her homemade jewelry business became increasingly profitable.

Tips.title: Positive Outcome
Tips.description: Can imply that the gains made were superior to other options or expectations.
Tips.example: His investment in renewable energy was more profitable than stocks.

senses.ex: Studying hard can be profitable for future job opportunities.

Tips.title: Personal Growth
Tips.description: Refers to activities or habits that result in personal development or improvement.
Tips.example: Regular exercise is a profitable habit for maintaining health.

Tips.title: Skill Enhancement
Tips.description: Often related to acquiring skills that will be valuable or advantageous for one's career or personal life.
Tips.example: Learning digital marketing skills will be profitable for your career.

Tips.title: Long-term Benefit
Tips.description: Indicates an advantage or positive outcome that may not be immediate but will emerge over time.
Tips.example: Investing time in learning a new language can be profitable long-term.

Advantageous.wordDefinition:
Advantageous refers to something that brings about an advantage or benefit in the long run, while profitable refers to something that brings financial gain or profit in the short term.

For example, getting an education can be advantageous because it could lead to better job opportunities and a higher salary in the future.

On the other hand, investing in a new business venture could be profitable in the short term (making money quickly), but may not necessarily be advantageous in the long run (perhaps it is not sustainable and the profits are not consistent).

Advantageous and profitable are both important concepts to consider, but they apply to different situations and outcomes.

Beneficial.wordDefinition:
Beneficial describes something that is helpful or advantageous, while profitable describes something that brings financial gain or profit.

For example, exercising regularly is beneficial for one's health, but it may not necessarily be profitable. On the other hand, investing in stocks may be profitable, but it may not necessarily be beneficial for one's health or well-being.

Beneficial is more commonly used when talking about non-financial advantages, such as personal growth or social impact, while profitable is more commonly used when talking about financial gains or benefits.

Gainful.wordDefinition:
Gainful refers to work or employment that pays a salary or income. It usually implies that the work is honest and legitimate, and the person doing it is making an effort to be productive.

For example, a job that helps a person support themselves and their family is a gainful employment.

Gainful is more commonly used to describe earning a living through work, while profitable is more commonly used to describe earning money from business ventures or investments.

Lucrative.wordDefinition:
Both lucrative and profitable are words used to describe something that generates a profit or makes money.

Lucrative refers specifically to something that is very profitable or brings in a lot of money. For example, a job opportunity that pays a high salary would be considered a lucrative opportunity.

Lucrative describes something that is particularly successful or profitable, while profitable is a more general term used to describe anything that is making money.

Productive.wordDefinition:
Productive means being able to produce something efficiently and successfully. It refers to the ability to create or achieve results or goals.

For example, a company can be productive if it is able to create innovative products or deliver services efficiently, but it may not necessarily be profitable if the production costs are high and revenue is not enough to cover expenses.

A company can be profitable if it sells products or services with a high demand, but may not necessarily be productive if it is not able to produce goods or services effectively.

Overall, being productive is about achieving goals and generating results, while being profitable is about making money.

Prosperous.wordDefinition:
Prosperous refers to something that is flourishing, thriving, and successful in all aspects. It includes not only financial success, but also personal well-being, happiness, and good fortune.

For example, a person who is prosperous may have a successful career, a happy family, and good health.

Profitable refers to financial success, while prosperous encompasses success in all aspects of life.

Remunerative.wordDefinition:
Remunerative refers to something that provides compensation or payment for services rendered. It implies being rewarded for one's work.

For example, a job can be remunerative if it provides a good salary or benefits to the employee.

Profitable is more related to financial gain, while remunerative is more related to compensation for work or services.

Successful.wordDefinition:
Successful means achieving or accomplishing a goal or objective. It is applicable in many aspects of life, including academics, sports, and personal relationships.

For example, if a student gets good grades and graduates from college, they are considered successful.

Profitable refers to making money, while successful refers to achieving a goal.

quotes.Text: War is hugely profitable. It creates so much money because it's so easy to spend money very fast. There are huge fortunes to be made. So there is always an encouragement to promote war and keep it going, to make sure that we identify people who are 'others' whom we can legitimately make war upon.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Roger Waters

quotes.Text: In trying to mentor and hire, I always encourage people to learn how to sell. We work hard to be profitable; you can do good and do well. They don't have to be mutually exclusive.
quotes.Name: Ilana Kloss

quotes.Text: My ambition is to figure out how to help people create their own health and how to turn that into a profitable business.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Esther Dyson

quotes.Text: The myth of fame and the myth of success is cultivated because it is monetisable and it is profitable.
quotes.Title: Irish Musician
quotes.Name: Hozier

quotes.Text: O God, O God, how weary, stale, flat, and unprofitable seem to me all the uses of this world!
quotes.Title: English Playwright
quotes.Name: William Shakespeare

quotes.Text: It is more profitable for your congressman to support the tobacco industry than your life.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Jackie Mason

quotes.Text: It is respectable to have no illusions, and safe, and profitable and dull.
quotes.Title: Polish Novelist
quotes.Name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.Text: Sometimes what's right isn't as important as what's profitable.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Trey Parker

quotes.Text: It is a profitable thing, if one is wise, to seem foolish.
quotes.Title: Greek Poet
quotes.Name: Aeschylus

quotes.Text: Never lie when the truth is more profitable.
quotes.Title: Polish Poet
quotes.Name: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec
